election_record.label: Vermont 1806 Governor

overview.note: A total of 584 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 311 for Israel Smith were rejected.

"A correct statement of the votes for Governor as canvassed by the Committee on Thursday last, viz. - Votes legally returned, Tichenor 8851. Smith 6930. Scat 320. Votes of 21 towns lost, Tichenor 584. Smith 311. Scat. 20 [Total number of votes cast, legal and not:] Tichenor 9,435. Smith 7,241. Scat. 340." Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT). October 15, 1806.

The September 22 edition of the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT) reported partial returns for governor and noted that "the mistake which occurred in the footing of the votes in our last week's paper, was unintentional--ill natured observations of federalists to the contrary notwithstanding: we cannot vouch for the correctness of many of the lists received, as nearly all of them were obtained from federalists."

The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22, lists the total votes at that point as 5870 for Isaac Tichenor and 5388 for Israel Smith. This edition also lists the vote counts by county (known as of September 22) and these votes are noted hereafter by county.
The Connecticut Gazette, October 29, reports 9445 total votes for Isaac Tichenor.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22, reports 981 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 734 for Israel Smith in Addison County.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: Several sources, including the Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), September 6, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, report 54 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 69 for Israel Smith in Addison.

sub_unit.name: Bridport
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 44 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Bridport.

sub_unit.name: Bristol
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 8 and 15, the Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 22, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 23, and the Political Observatory, September 19, report 94 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 13 for Israel Smith in Bristol.

sub_unit.name: Cornwall
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, reverse the returns for Isaac Tichenor and Israel Smith in Cornwall.
The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 12 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 69 for Israel Smith in Cornwall.

sub_unit.name: Ferrisburgh
sub_unit.note: Several sources, including the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 8 and 15, the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 23, the Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, and the Political Observatory, September 19, report 88 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 30 for Israel Smith in Ferrisburgh.
The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, reports 83 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 30 for Israel Smith in Ferrisburgh.

sub_unit.name: Hancock
sub_unit.note: The votes from Hancock were rejected because there were "no ballots." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 8.
The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 22, reports 30 votes for Israel Smith in Hancock.

The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, and the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, report 3 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 35 for Israel Smith in Hancock.

sub_unit.name: Middlebury
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, the Post Boy, September 16, and the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), September 3, report 98 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Middlebury.
The Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), September 6, reports 96 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 34 for Israel Smith in Middlebury.

sub_unit.name: Monkton
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 100 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 30 for Israel Smith in Monkton.

sub_unit.name: Panton
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 8 and 15, the Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 22, the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 23, and the Political Observatory, September 19, report 54 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 69 for Israel Smith in Panton.

sub_unit.name: Vergennes
sub_unit.note: Several sources, including the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 8, the Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, and the Political Observatory, September 19, report 108 vote for Isaac Tichenor and 6 for Israel Smith in Vergennes.
The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 49 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 29 for Israel Smith in Vergennes.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 22, reports 6 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 2 for Israel Smith in Warren.

sub_unit.name: Weybridge
sub_unit.note: The Political Observatory, September 19, reports 45 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Weybridge.

sub_unit.name: Bennington
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22, reports 849 votes for Isaac Tichenor and over 800 (the last 2 digits illegible) for Israel Smith in Addison County.

sub_unit.name: Arlington
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, reports 135 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Arlington.

sub_unit.name: Bennington
sub_unit.note: James Witherill is listed as James Wetherell in Bennington Town Records.

sub_unit.name: Landgrove
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports no votes in Landgrove.

sub_unit.name: Manchester
sub_unit.note: The Post-Boy (Windsor, VT), September 16, reports 92 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Manchester.
The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 83 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 102 for Israel Smith in Manchester.

sub_unit.name: Pownal
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, reports 145 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Pownal.

sub_unit.name: Sandgate
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 23, reports 57 votes for Israel Smith in Sandgate.

sub_unit.name: Winhall
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 37 votes for Isaac Tichenoro in Windhall.

sub_unit.name: Woodford
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, reports 18 votes for Israel Smith in Woodford.

sub_unit.name: Caledonia
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22, reports 200 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 106 for Israel Smith in Caledonia County.

sub_unit.name: Cabot
sub_unit.note: The votes from Cabot were rejected.
The North Star (Danville, VT), September 19, reports 60 votes for Israel Smith in Cabot.

sub_unit.name: Danville
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, reports 94 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 78 for Israel Smith in Danville.
The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, reports 84 votes for Israel Smith in Danville.
The Post-Boy (Windsor, VT), September 16, and the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, report 90 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 80 for Israel Smith in Danville.

sub_unit.name: Deweysburg Gore
sub_unit.note: Deweysburg Gore is referred to as both Deweysburg Gore and Deweysburgh in various sources.
The votes from Deweysburg Gore were rejected because the "certificate [was] not signed by town clerk." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 8.

The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, and the Post Boy, September 16, report 10 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 14 for Israel Smith in Deweysburg Gore.
The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, reports 8 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 14 for Israel Smith in Deweysburg Gore.

sub_unit.name: Marshfield
sub_unit.note: The North Star (Danville, VT), September 19, reports 22 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 5 for Israel Smith in Marshfield.

sub_unit.name: Peacham
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, and the Post Boy, September 16, report 100 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 12 for Israel Smith in Peacham.

sub_unit.name: Woodbury
sub_unit.note: The votes from Woodbury were rejected because the "certificate [was] not signed by town clerk." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 8.

sub_unit.name: Chittenden
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22, reports 203 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 139 for Israel Smith in Chittenden County.

sub_unit.name: Bolton
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports no votes in Bolton.

sub_unit.name: Burlington
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15,the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, and the Vermont Centinel (Burlington, VT), September 3, report 29 votes for Israel Smith in Burlington.
Israel Smith has been credited here with one vote cast for "I. Smith" in Burlington.

sub_unit.name: Underhill
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 50 votes for Israel Smith in Underhill.

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: Essex County is not listed in the partial results reported by county in the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22 edition.

sub_unit.name: Brunswick
sub_unit.note: The votes from Brunswick were rejected because there was "no certificate of town clerk, and ballots [were] not enclosed." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.name: Lunenburg
sub_unit.note: The votes from Lunenburg were rejected because the certificate was "not signed by town clerk." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22, reports 447 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 414 for Israel Smith in Franklin County.

sub_unit.name: Georgia
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 56 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Georgia.

sub_unit.name: Highgate
sub_unit.note: The votes from Highgate were rejected because there was "no certificate by town clerk." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.name: Johnson
sub_unit.note: The votes from Johnson were rejected because there were "no ballots." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: The votes from Montgomery were rejected because there were "no ballots." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 8.

sub_unit.name: Sterling
sub_unit.note: The votes from Sterling were rejected because there was "no certificate by town clerk." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 8.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22, reports 649 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 516 for Israel Smith in Orange County.

sub_unit.name: Berlin
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Berlin.

sub_unit.name: Fairlee
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, reports 15 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 38 for Israel Smith in Fairlee.
The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 26 votes for Israel Smith in Fairlee.

sub_unit.name: Roxbury
sub_unit.note: The votes from Roxbury were rejected because there were "no ballots." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 8.

sub_unit.name: Thetford
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 22, reports these returns from Tunbridge.

sub_unit.name: Tunbridge
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 23,the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, and the Post Boy, September 16, report 58 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 8 for Israel Smith in Tunbridge. These figures may be an accidental repeat of Thetford's results, which were then repeated in multiple sources. In the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), Thetford is listed on the line previous to Tunbridge.

sub_unit.name: Orleans
sub_unit.note: Orleans County is not listed in the partial results reported by county in the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22 edition.

sub_unit.name: Barton
sub_unit.note: The votes from Barton were rejected because there were "no ballots enclosed." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.note: The votes from Duncansboro were rejected because there were "no ballots." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.note: The votes from Holland were rejected because there were "no ballots." Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.name: Hyde Park
sub_unit.note: The votes from Hyde Park were rejected because they were "not signed by town clerk." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.name: Troy
sub_unit.note: The votes from Troy were rejected because there were "no ballots." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.name: Hubbardton
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Hubbardton.

sub_unit.name: Ira
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Ira.

sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports no votes in Mount Holly.

sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), September 6, the Post Boy, September 16, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, report 90 votes for Israel Smith in Pawlet.

sub_unit.name: Philadelphia
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the Post Boy, September 16, and the Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), September 6, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, report 5 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 13 for Israel Smith in Philadelphia.
The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 15 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 13 for Israel Smith in Philadelphia.

sub_unit.name: Pittsfield
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports no votes for Isaac Tichenor and 30 fo Israel Smith in Pittsfield.

sub_unit.name: Poultney
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the Post Boy, September 16, the Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), September 6, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, report 90 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Poultney.

sub_unit.name: Rutland
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 8 and 15, and the Political Observatory, September 19, report 86 votes for Israel Smith in Rutland.

sub_unit.name: Sherburne
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Sherburne.

sub_unit.name: Shrewsbury
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports no votes in Shrewsbury.

sub_unit.name: Tinmouth
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 8 and 15, the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 23, and the Political Observatory, September 19, report 35 votes for Israel Smith in Tinmouth.

The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the Post Boy, September 16, the Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), September 6, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, report 32 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 27 for Israel Smith in Tinmouth.

sub_unit.name: Wells
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 14 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Wells.

sub_unit.name: Windham
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22, reports 770 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 219 for Israel Smith in Windham.

sub_unit.name: Brattleborough
sub_unit.note: The Political Observatory, September 12, and the Political Observatory, September 19, report no votes for Israel Smith in Brattleborough.
The Political Observatory, September 12 reports 6 scattering votes in addition to the 133 votes listed for Isaac Tichenor.

The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 22, the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, the Post Boy, September 16, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 23, report 6 votes for Israel Smith in Brattleborough.

sub_unit.name: Dummerston
sub_unit.note: The votes from Dummerston were rejected because there was "no certificate of the constable." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly 1806, 7.

sub_unit.name: Putney
sub_unit.note: The Political Observatory, September 12 lists the votes for the top 2 candidates as noted above, but no votes for anyone else, no scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Somerset
sub_unit.note: The votes from Somerset were rejected because there were "no ballots enclosed." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.name: Stratton
sub_unit.note: Town Records for Stratton do not list any vote for Jonathan Robinson, only the votes as listed for the top two candidates.

sub_unit.name: Wardsboro
sub_unit.note: The Political Observatory, September 19, reports 5 votes for Israel Smith in Wardsboro.

sub_unit.name: Westminster
sub_unit.note: The Reporter, September 6 and 13 editions, report 124 votes for Israel Smith in Westminster.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 22, reports 744 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 1233 for Israel Smith in Windsor County.

sub_unit.name: Barnard
sub_unit.note: Several sources, including the Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, the Post Boy, September 16, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, report 46 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 22 for Israel Smith in Barnard.

sub_unit.name: Bethel
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, report 23 votes for Issac Tichenor in Bethel.
The Post-Boy (Windsor, VT), September 16, reports 3 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Bethel.

sub_unit.name: Bridgewater
sub_unit.note: The Post-Boy (Windsor, VT), September 16, reports 84 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Bridgewater.

sub_unit.name: Cavendish
sub_unit.note: The votes from Cavendish were rejected because there was "no date to certificate." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, p.7.
The Cavendish Town Records and the Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, report 72 votes for Israel Smith in Cavendish.

sub_unit.name: Chester
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, reports 45 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Chester.
The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 50 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 160 for Israel Smith in Chester.

sub_unit.name: Hartford
sub_unit.note: The votes from Hartford were rejected because there were "no ballots." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.
The Hartford Town Records report 66 votes for Israel Smith.

The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15,the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, report 92 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 80 for Israel Smith in Hartford.

sub_unit.name: Hartland
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, report 105 votes for Israel Smith in Hartland.

sub_unit.name: Norwich
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 47 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Norwich.

sub_unit.name: Plymouth
sub_unit.note: The votes from Plymouth were rejected because there were "no ballots." Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1806, 7.

sub_unit.name: Pomfret
sub_unit.note: The Weekly Wanderer (Randolph, VT), September 15, and the Post Boy, September 16, report 6 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 74 for Israel Smith in Pomfret.

sub_unit.name: Rochester
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), September 16, and the Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, report 6 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 74 for Israel Smith in Rochester.

sub_unit.name: Weathersfield
sub_unit.note: The Post-Boy (Windsor, VT), September 16, reports 72 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 66 for Israel Smith in Weathersfield.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Gazette, an Epitome of the World (Bennington, VT), September 15, reports 33 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Windsor.
The Political Observatory, September 12 lists the votes for the top 2 candidates as noted above and mentions 6 scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Woodstock
sub_unit.note: The Post-Boy (Windsor, VT), September 16, reports 39 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 170 for Israel Smith in Woodstock.
